content: Is there still a zoom catch up in 20 mins?
I note it has a line through on the confluence page...

Indeed: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+FHIR+Shorthand+Track.

Our zoom room isn't open until tomorrow morning!

I guess we won't tonight.
okay, I was getting ready to rejoin. Is the first thing our 10amET tomorrow?
Oh bother. That's 2am my time. I'm dedicated, but...
10am is a basic tutorial. I expect the kickoff will be first thing (9am EDT). 1am is so much more reasonable, right @David Hay? @Mark Kramer -- do I have that right?

Just to put my 2c in - my interest is playing with the SUSHI / IG builder integration work that is being worked on. I tend to develop on sushi - get that all working - then invoke IG builder and work on the more detailed issues that it finds...
@David Hay -- I think we'll be publishing a beta in the next couple of hours that you can start playing with.
What are you intending to cover off on the intro?
@Chris Moesel - perfect!
We start at 9:00 am. Looking over the participants, I don't think too many of us are going to be in the FHIR intro tutorial.
I assumed @David Hay was asking about the basic tutorial (for FSH).
@David Hay you won't miss anything you don't already know. I suspect you could teach the intro :) The advanced and the IG publisher integration will be much more relevant.
Yes - hoping to attend those 2 tomorrow morning (5am - much more civilized - I'm a morning person!)
Kicking off the tutorial now

Mark Kramer said:

Kicking off the tutorial now

Are you also recording it?
Is the intro slide set available?
next tutorial coming up in a minute? (or so...)
Yes, advanced tutorial starting now!
Note that the slides have been uploaded for the basic and advanced tutorials on FSH: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+FHIR+Shorthand+Track
Kurt Allen is going to present his FSH tools for advanced modularity at 11:00 AM Eastern time today (45 minutes from now). Please come if you are interested in some cool tools.
I wish I could be there. I hope it gets recorded? Or another time is available?
BTW -- The integration/configuration tutorial is also posted on Confluence now. See Nick's link above.
Did this get recorded?
@Mark Kramer and the MITRE team: Thanks for hosting this track and the work in general! :clap:

For those of you coming to the Shorthand track tomorrow and Friday, the track is a bit different than traditional connectathon fare. We will feature "office hours" (open questions and discussion, hands on assistance) and the following tutorials (with some exciting new content):

1) Introduction and Beginning FHIR Shorthand: Motivations, Overview, Basics of the FHIR Shorthand language
2) Advanced FHIR Shorthand: Producing IGs with SUSHI, extensions, slicing, instances, caret paths, rule sets,
3) Wicked FHIR Shorthand: Planned future power-user features: Macros, soft indexing, context paths, logical models
4) FSHing Equipment: Tools to help with FSH: FSH Online, Go FSH, FSH School

The schedule is as follows (times in Eastern US time zone):

THURSDAY:
9:00 am - 6:00 pm – Open Office hours
10:00 am Introduction and Beginning FHIR Shorthand
12:00 noon Advanced FHIR Shorthand
2:00 pm Wicked FHIR Shorthand
4:00 pm FSHing Equipment

FRIDAY:
9:00 am - 6:00 pm – Open Office hours
10:00 am FSHing Equipment
12:00 noon Wicked FHIR Shorthand
2:00 pm Introduction and Beginning FHIR Shorthand
4:00 pm Advanced FHIR Shorthand
Just a reminder -- the Beginning Shorthand tutorial is scheduled for 10am EDT today. Sandy is working on putting it in the Whova schedule w/ its own link. Stay tuned!

FHIR Shorthand Connectathon Track participants. Having trouble finding the track? Here's the basic navigation to get there through Whova:
Agenda -> 9:00 AM -> Connectathon Tracks: 45 Subsessions -> FHIR Shorthand Track

https://fshschool.org/docs/tutorials/ -- Hands-on tutorials
